author: boooto
content: Isn't that the fundamental property of layer 2s tho? It will always be more risky than L1 because if it wasn't, everything from L2 should be incorporated into L1

author: sky.cactus
content: In theory, L2s should have L1 security minus risk of bug in code.  That isn't how things work right now though.  At the moment L2s have the lesser of L1 security minus risk of bug in code and security of L2 backdoors/admin keys/upgrade keys.
